comment: Dr. Eanes is a good prof. He accommodated for me when I needed it and gave me many resources to help with my personal situation. He posts everything you need on D2L and sends reminder emails He gave out weekly assignments and quizzes. The quizzes are easy, but the assignments are vague and difficult. The grading system is so confusing. For me, 4/5

You will not regret signing up for his class. In-class lecture was fun and he knew exactly what he was talking about. He a musician himself so sometime class time would be us learning music through his personal experiences. All the test was online and all the quizzes are online. If you just do what you are suppose to , you will pass the class
Professor Eanes is extremely understanding and straight forward. You'll do fine as long as you do the online work.

Dr. Eanes is great. His passion for music is real and he's a hilarious person in general, making him one of the most entertaining professors I've had (often the case with music teachers, no?). My only gripe is that it's hard to remember to do the quizzes and tests because they're all online and he rarely reminds you about them.

I took his online class and he is honestly the least helpful professor I have ever had. Do not think that you are going to be able to ask him questions or get his help with any of the work you have been assigned. You have to figure it out on your own. He is only there to grade your papers. Period. You might do better to take his lecture course.

DONT TAKE THIS CLASS ONLINE.... I think he keeps forgetting that this class is just an APPRECIATION CLASS. His assignments seem like something that would be assigned to a music major.  Long assignments, weekly quizzes, makes you put in a lot of effort.  Over all this class is not worth the struggle.  I would've never taken it if it wasn't required

Loved Prof Eanes!He is the head of the music department so he knows what he is talking about. He is very passionate about the subject. The tests are easy if you pay attention to the notes which are online, but i would come to class because he explains things well. You have to attend 3 concerts but doesnt make you write a paper like other professors
Do not buy the book, pay attention in class, nice man ask for help if you need it and you should pass the class! very easy A

I thought he made class extremely engaging. His tests are easy if you pay attention in class. I didn't even buy the book. The project is simple, but the guidelines for it are not very clear, so ask any questions you may have.

GREAT teacher! SO passionate, shows youtube videos to explain and show examples of the stuff he's teaching about. Very nice guy. His tests are pretty easy, except the listening parts which really suck. But there are only 4 to 5 listening questions on the tests. He keeps the class interesting. Take him!

Fantastic teacher. He is so passionate, uses powerpoints but doesn't read from them he expands on them, tells interesting facts, we listen/watch youtube videos related to the content, he has a clear plan every class, if you ever miss anything he has a class schedule online, study guides, if you go to class and pay attention/study the tests are easy
Take this guy!  He loves music and his passion is contagious.   I love the historical tidbits that he throws in.  Go to the concerts and come to class, you'll be fine.
Great professor who really knows his stuff!  He makes the class interesting.

GREAT class! Prof shares his passion for music and has interesting presentation. Come to class, pay attention and you will get an A. He gives very clear study guides and tests are easy. Group project rather than final exam. Mandatory concert attendance, three on campus, one ASO.  EASY and fun class.

TAKE HIM! He knows what he's talking about and loves it. Very understanding and helpful. Attendance is taken on random days so go to class even though notes are posted online. The final is a simple GROUP project. Will need to study your notes in order to be prepared for the tests. TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!

This is a easy class. He takes attendance on random days; must attend class. Test are very easy. All notes are power-points. The final is a group project. He loves music and knows everything there is to know about it. Also makes you go to 2 ksu concerts and an atl symphony concert. I recommend him if you want an easy class and if you go to class

not a hard class, this guy LOVES his music. You have three tests, a group project that acts as the final, 2 on campus concerts, and an Atlanta Symphony Orchestra to attend. Not hard to pull a B and by far the easiest appreciation class that i've heard of.

Mr. Eanes is a nice guy, and really loves his music. He's just a big music nerd. Tests are easy if you study and listen to the music online enough to recognize it. (listening portions of tests) Group project at the end, 2 on campus concerts, and one Atlanta Symphony are required.  Pay attention and come to class- you'll do fine.

He lets music majors talk loudly during class, which is really annoying. He also emailed us less than 24 hours before our final exam to tell us he was changing it from a group interview to an individual interview. If you enjoy music and think "History of American Music" should be a fun class, think again. I was very disappointed.

Great class. Come to class lectures or you will not understand his power point notes as he elaborates and adds things when he lectures. 2 on campus concerts and 1 Atlanta Symphony concert is required and there is a group project at the end of the class, no final. Listening is a major part of his exams. Overall good professor.

Very friendly. Clear guide lines. Easy A if you just go to the concerts and come to class. One paper. Four tests. Three required concerts to attend. Breeze of a class. Definitely recommend Prof. Eanes.

Dr. Eanes is an interesting professor. He He teaches what he is supposed to and thats about it. Not too terribly exciting. Class is over all an easy one as long as you study. Not the most helpful or friendly guy in the world.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!! Unless you have a comprehensive background in music you will fail. He calls on you just to see you panic. If you are going to major in music you will be fine and he will like you, other than that stay away at all costs!!

Great professor!! I would highly recommend him. Come to class, take good notes, and really study for his tests. They are hard, but he teaches well. Three mandatory concerts, three tests, and a group project. Take him!

I had him for study abroad and he was pretty freakin' cool. Knowledgable, creative, friendly, and reasonably stern are characteristics I would use to describe him. If you pay attention in class, follow his requirements, and are only late because you died, then you should get an A. :)

One of the worst classes I have ever been in. Eanes does not seem like he enjoys teaching, he teaches as if students have a significant musical background, which many do not, considering it is required Music Appreciation. He was impossible to get in touch with. I recommend taking ANYONE else. Worst teacher I've had.

Great teacher, enjoyed the class.  Group project was fun, though with the large class the presentations got boring.  Hardest part was telling pieces of classical works apart.  Some were easy, but some were too close for me to call. Required attendance and if people leave, he definately takes attendance.  I would recommend him.

I knew nothing about music before this class and I came out with an A (barely). Three tests and three mandatory music events. You have to really study for the tests, but they are not hard or tricky. Pretty easy, enjoyable class.
Pretty easy. Take notes, go to all of the events, and make sure you study. His tests will be really hard unless you study. You should get an A but just do the work and don't blow it off.
Awesome professor! Class is mandatory because notes are not put online. Study guide before tests. Tests are very easy if you study.

Does not seem like he enjoys teaching this class, but he tries. Lots of material, but didn't need to read the book to get an 'A'. Just attend class, go to the required concerts. One paper on your experience on attending an ASO performance.

This guy is a great instructor, not to mention the fact that he is the concert master of the cobb symphony...so he's very well qualified to teach music. He posts very detailed study guides to all three tests and the tests aren't very long at all. I don't see how anyone could make less than an A in his class. He will get rather annoyed if you talk o
I would definitely reccomend Dr. Eanes.  His class was really interesting.  Tests weren't bad at all as long as you look over your notes.  Pretty easy A.
takes attendance and if you miss 5 classes you fail. Also there are 4 mandatory attendance to music events outside of school
He was really nice and know a lot about music. He is excited to teach and the tests are exactly what he tell you they will be. Just know the study guide and you can make an A.

Class covers too much material, tests were VERY detailed and difficult. However, its easy to pass the class if you do outside activites and assignments. I RARELY had any homework!:) Very helpful and enthusiastic,funny,makes music interesting! Set $$ aside to attend concerts and such (requirement). Fun class, great professor.High Recommended. :)
Mediocre class. Lots of outside assignments and $$ investment. The tests weren't too bad as long as you memorized your stuff.
makes music interesting in a way that i have never seen before.
Dr. Eanes is very passionate about music...however he covers too much information in one semester.  Tests are extremely difficult and comprehensive.  This class is enjoyable, but be ready to work.
No Comments

Dr. Eanes is a great professor.  What he gives you on the review is exactly what will be on there.  He's very clear and his lectures are not boring.  Show up to class, take notes, and study and you'll get an A.
